title: Will ACLED record any riot/protest events in Sierra Leone between 15 October 2017 and 31 October 2017?
preds: One recorded by ACLED on Oct. 12.

Any guess why the following did not count?
Sierra Leone News: Disabled people protest at State House
Based on general news and GJP consensus.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.

Riot/Protest recorded by ACLED on Oct. 12.
Leaving forecast unchanged.
Based on general news and GJP consensus.

Background: last election, 2012; most recent civil war ended in 2014; Ebola epidemic 2014-2015; next election March 7; today the two major parties chose their presidential candidates; there is reason to believe the ruling party, APC, may not play fair. Might this spark protests, riots in the next two weeks?
Student/Faculty protests in October of 2016 and 2017.

There have been 15 riots/protests this year but the vast majority were about the situation in Njala University which seems to have been resolved. Given the short time frame and how long it has been since a protest I don't think one happens in the next two weeks.
14 riots this year but many are very close one from the other.
There is a possibility of social unrest.
